name: Square array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = S(n+k) - S(n) - S(k) - min(n,k), where S(k) = A000788(k-1).
comment: For each pair (n,k), at least one of the conditions in the three formulas can be satisfied, so the problem of finding T(n,k) is reduced to finding T(n',k') with n'+k' < n+k and n',k' >= 1. Therefore T(n,k) can be uniquely determined with these formulas and the base cases T(2^t,2^t) = 0.
This also gives the inductive proof that T(n,k) >= 0.
link: Yifan Xie, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5050 (first 100 antidiagonals)
Yifan Xie, Proof of the formulas
formula: If 2^i < n <= n+k <= 2^(i+1) for some i, T(n,k) = T(n-2^i,k) + min(n-2^i,k).
If 2^i < k <= n+k <= 2^(i+1) for some i, T(n,k) = T(n,k-2^i) + min(n,k-2^i).
If n,k < 2^i <= n+k for some i, T(n,k) = T(2^i-n,2^i-k).
program: s=vector(10000); s[1] = 0; for(n=2, 10000, s[n] = s[n-1] + hammingweight(n-1));
